title: Predicting maintenance of NYC subways
description: Predictive maintenance framework composed of linear and tree-based models to predict most vulnerable lines. Showcased at 2025 NYC Open Data Week

title: IntelliBART database

title: The New York Trilogy
description: The New York Trilogy visualizes the city not by zoning codes or census tracts, but by how it's lived. From run clubs to restaurant weeks, this series maps the kinetic, cultural, and psychogeographic layers of New York City. Stay tuned for a film guide!

description: Built robust preprocessing pipeline (stopword removal, lemmatization, and vectorization) and feature extraction models (Bag of Words and N-Grams) to classify tweets as disaster-related or not.

title: Cornell's TechTakes App
description: Developed hi-fidelity prototype for Cornell Tech students to rate, review, and discuss courses and professors

title: Designing Interactions in VR

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer

title: CSAA Insurance Group, an AAA Insurer

Summer 2022: Developed a business strategy for specialized Electric Vehicle insurance coverage, earning leadership recognition for rigorous roadmap and teamwork 
 Summer 2021: Identified +5.5% sales growth opportunity by analyzing competitiveness and market share geo-correlations using SQL

title: Virtualization of the Public Sphere (Investigative Journalism)
description: Investigated fragmentation of the public sphere following the user exodus from Twitter/X to Bluesky after the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election and assessed how platform design and moderation influence democratic discourse

title: Project Manager @ Microfinance at Berkeley

title: Impact of Quarantine Mandates on COVID-19 Cases in the US
description: Estimated the effects of strict quarantine mandates across six intervention windows and 3,143 U.S. counties

title: Does the Environmental Kuznets Curve Hold? An Empirical Examination
description: Verified the Environmental Kuznets Curve using OLS regression on panel data from 161 countries in R; addressed endogeneity and omitted variable bias via fixed effects and instrumental variables, finding empirical support for a parabolic income–pollution relationship.

title: Handwritten Digit Recognition using Gaussian Classifiers
description: Built a Gaussian classifier in SciPy and Scikit-learn to recognize handwritten digits from MNIST by applying Linear Discriminant Analysis for dimensionality reduction and modeling class-conditional pixel distributions via maximum likelihood estimation

title: Image Recoginition using Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)
description: Built a convolutional neural network to classify images from the CIFAR-10 dataset using PyTorch and TensorFlow

title: Local File Management System
description: Built a version control system in Java to manage local repositories, track file history, and enable restoration

title: 2048 Game
description: Implemented the core game logic for a fully functional 2048 clone in Java

title: 2D Tile-Based World Exploration Game
description: Co-built a 2D tile-based game in Java that allowed users to explore and interact with objects in pseudorandomly generated worlds

title: How does disinformation spread?
description: Designed a bilingual survey experiment in English and Hindi as part of a PhD student’s research on misinformation and Bayesian belief updating

title: Impact of Foreign Student Migration on US Innovation
